en.title: Liquidity Ratios Calculator
en.seoTitle: Liquidity Ratios Calculator - What Are My Liquidity Ratios?
en.metaDescription: Calculate current ratio, quick ratio, and cash ratio to assess your company's short-term liquidity and ability to meet immediate obligations.
longTailKeywords: what is a good quick ratio
en.description: Analyze your company's short-term liquidity with our comprehensive liquidity ratios calculator. Calculate current ratio, quick ratio, cash ratio, and working capital to assess ability to meet short-term obligations and manage cash flow effectively.
en.summary: Calculate key liquidity ratios to assess short-term financial health.
instructions: Enter current assets value (cash, inventory, receivables)
Input current liabilities (payables, short-term debt)
Specify inventory value for quick ratio calculation
Enter cash and equivalents for cash ratio
Click calculate to see comprehensive liquidity analysis

seoContent.introduction: Liquidity ratios are essential financial metrics that measure a company's ability to meet its short-term obligations using its most liquid assets. Our liquidity ratios calculator helps you analyze current ratio, quick ratio, and cash ratio to assess financial health and operational efficiency. These ratios provide critical insights into cash management, working capital, and short-term solvency.
benefits: Assess ability to meet short-term obligations
Make informed credit and investment decisions
steps: Gather balance sheet information for current period
Enter current assets and liabilities data
Calculate multiple liquidity ratios simultaneously
Compare results with industry benchmarks
Monitor ratios over time for trend analysis
inputsExplained: Current Assets: Assets expected to be converted to cash within one year
Current Liabilities: Obligations due within one year or operating cycle
Inventory: Goods held for sale or raw materials (less liquid)
Cash & Cash Equivalents: Most liquid assets available for immediate use
seoContent.formulaExplanation: Liquidity ratios measure short-term financial strength. Current ratio divides current assets by current liabilities. Quick ratio excludes inventory from current assets. Cash ratio uses only cash and equivalents. Working capital is current assets minus current liabilities.
examples: Current ratio above 2.0 indicates strong liquidity but may suggest inefficient asset use
Quick ratio above 1.0 shows ability to meet obligations without selling inventory
Cash ratio above 20% indicates excellent immediate liquidity
Negative working capital may signal cash flow problems
resultsExplanation: Current Ratio: Measures overall short-term liquidity including all current assets
Quick Ratio: Assesses liquidity excluding inventory (acid test ratio)
Cash Ratio: Most conservative measure using only cash and equivalents
Working Capital: Excess of current assets over current liabilities
seoContent.whoItsFor: This calculator is invaluable for financial analysts, business owners, creditors, investors, and accounting professionals who need to assess short-term financial health. Anyone involved in financial analysis or credit evaluation will find these ratios essential.
seoContent.disclaimer: Liquidity ratios should be analyzed alongside other financial metrics. Seasonal businesses may show different patterns. Industry norms vary significantly. Consult financial professionals for comprehensive analysis.

faqs.question: How accurate is this calculator?
faqs.answer: This calculator uses industry-standard formulas to provide accurate results based on your inputs. Results are estimates and may vary.

faqs.question: What information do I need?
faqs.answer: You'll need the specific input values required by the calculator. All required fields are clearly labeled.

faqs.question: Can I save my results?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can save results by taking a screenshot or noting the values for future reference.

faqs.question: Is my data secure?
faqs.answer: Yes, all calculations are performed locally in your browser. We don't store your data.

faqs.question: How often should I use this?
faqs.answer: Use the calculator whenever you need to make calculations or when your situation changes.

es.title: Calculadora de Ratios de Liquidez
es.seoTitle: Calculadora de Ratios de Liquidez - ¿Cuáles Son Mis Ratios de Liquidez?
es.metaDescription: Calcula ratio corriente, ratio rápido y ratio de efectivo para evaluar la liquidez a corto plazo y capacidad para cumplir obligaciones inmediatas.
longTailKeywords: qué es un buen ratio rápido
es.description: Analiza la liquidez a corto plazo de tu empresa con nuestra calculadora completa de ratios de liquidez. Calcula ratio corriente, ratio rápido, ratio de efectivo y capital de trabajo para evaluar capacidad de cumplir obligaciones a corto plazo y gestionar flujo de efectivo efectivamente.
es.summary: Calcula ratios clave de liquidez para evaluar salud financiera a corto plazo.
instructions: Ingresa valor de activos corrientes (efectivo, inventario, cuentas por cobrar)
Introduce pasivos corrientes (cuentas por pagar, deuda a corto plazo)
Especifica valor de inventario para cálculo de ratio rápido
Ingresa efectivo y equivalentes para ratio de efectivo
Haz clic en calcular para ver análisis completo de liquidez

seoContent.introduction: Liquidity ratios are essential financial metrics that measure a company's ability to meet its short-term obligations using its most liquid assets. Our liquidity ratios calculator helps you analyze current ratio, quick ratio, and cash ratio to assess financial health and operational efficiency. These ratios provide critical insights into cash management, working capital, and short-term solvency.
benefits: Assess ability to meet short-term obligations
Make informed credit and investment decisions
steps: Gather balance sheet information for current period
Enter current assets and liabilities data
Calculate multiple liquidity ratios simultaneously
Compare results with industry benchmarks
Monitor ratios over time for trend analysis
inputsExplained: Activos Corrientes: Activos esperados a convertirse en efectivo dentro de un año
Pasivos Corrientes: Obligaciones vencidas dentro de un año o ciclo operativo
Inventario: Mercancías para venta o materias primas (menos líquidas)
Efectivo y Equivalentes: Activos más líquidos disponibles para uso inmediato
seoContent.formulaExplanation: Los ratios de liquidez miden fortaleza financiera a corto plazo. Ratio corriente divide activos corrientes entre pasivos corrientes. Ratio rápido excluye inventario de activos corrientes. Ratio de efectivo usa solo efectivo y equivalentes. Capital de trabajo es activos corrientes menos pasivos corrientes.
examples: Ratio corriente por encima de 2.0 indica liquidez fuerte pero puede sugerir uso ineficiente de activos
Ratio rápido por encima de 1.0 muestra capacidad para cumplir obligaciones sin vender inventario
Ratio de efectivo por encima de 20% indica liquidez inmediata excelente
Capital de trabajo negativo puede señalar problemas de flujo de efectivo
resultsExplanation: Ratio Corriente: Mide liquidez general a corto plazo incluyendo todos activos corrientes
Ratio Rápido: Evalúa liquidez excluyendo inventario (ratio prueba ácida)
Ratio de Efectivo: Medida más conservadora usando solo efectivo y equivalentes
Capital de Trabajo: Exceso de activos corrientes sobre pasivos corrientes
seoContent.whoItsFor: Esta calculadora es invaluable para analistas financieros, dueños de negocios, acreedores, inversores y profesionales de contabilidad que necesitan evaluar salud financiera a corto plazo. Cualquier persona involucrada en análisis financiero o evaluación de crédito encontrará estos ratios esenciales.
seoContent.disclaimer: Los ratios de liquidez deben analizarse junto con otras métricas financieras. Empresas estacionales pueden mostrar patrones diferentes. Normas de industria varían significativamente. Consulta profesionales financieros para análisis comprehensivo.

pt.title: Calculadora de Índices de Liquidez
pt.seoTitle: Calculadora de Índices de Liquidez - Quais São Meus Índices de Liquidez?
pt.metaDescription: Calcule índice corrente, índice rápido e índice de caixa para avaliar liquidez de curto prazo e capacidade para cumprir obrigações imediatas.
longTailKeywords: o que é um bom índice rápido
pt.description: Analise liquidez de curto prazo de sua empresa com nossa calculadora completa de índices de liquidez. Calcule índice corrente, índice rápido, índice de caixa e capital de giro para avaliar capacidade de cumprir obrigações de curto prazo e gerenciar fluxo de caixa efetivamente.
pt.summary: Calcule índices-chave de liquidez para avaliar saúde financeira de curto prazo.
instructions: Insira valor de ativos circulantes (caixa, estoque, contas a receber)
Digite passivos circulantes (contas a pagar, dívida de curto prazo)
Especifique valor de estoque para cálculo de índice rápido
Insira caixa e equivalentes para índice de caixa
Clique em calcular para ver análise completa de liquidez

seoContent.introduction: Liquidity ratios are essential financial metrics that measure a company's ability to meet its short-term obligations using its most liquid assets. Our liquidity ratios calculator helps you analyze current ratio, quick ratio, and cash ratio to assess financial health and operational efficiency. These ratios provide critical insights into cash management, working capital, and short-term solvency.
benefits: Assess ability to meet short-term obligations
Make informed credit and investment decisions
steps: Gather balance sheet information for current period
Enter current assets and liabilities data
Calculate multiple liquidity ratios simultaneously
Compare results with industry benchmarks
Monitor ratios over time for trend analysis
inputsExplained: Ativos Circulantes: Ativos esperados a serem convertidos em caixa dentro de um ano
Passivos Circulantes: Obrigações vencidas dentro de um ano ou ciclo operacional
Estoque: Mercadorias para venda ou matérias-primas (menos líquidas)
Caixa e Equivalentes: Ativos mais líquidos disponíveis para uso imediato
seoContent.formulaExplanation: Índices de liquidez medem força financeira de curto prazo. Índice corrente divide ativos circulantes por passivos circulantes. Índice rápido exclui estoque de ativos circulantes. Índice de caixa usa apenas caixa e equivalentes. Capital de giro é ativos circulantes menos passivos circulantes.
examples: Índice corrente acima de 2.0 indica liquidez forte mas pode sugerir uso ineficiente de ativos
Índice rápido acima de 1.0 mostra capacidade de cumprir obrigações sem vender estoque
Índice de caixa acima de 20% indica liquidez imediata excelente
Capital de giro negativo pode sinalizar problemas de fluxo de caixa
resultsExplanation: Índice Corrente: Mede liquidez geral de curto prazo incluindo todos ativos circulantes
Índice Rápido: Avalia liquidez excluindo estoque (índice teste ácido)
Índice de Caixa: Medida mais conservadora usando apenas caixa e equivalentes
Capital de Giro: Excesso de ativos circulantes sobre passivos circulantes
seoContent.whoItsFor: Esta calculadora é invaluable para analistas financeiros, donos de negócios, credores, investidores e profissionais de contabilidade que precisam avaliar saúde financeira de curto prazo. Qualquer pessoa envolvida em análise financeira ou avaliação de crédito encontrará estes índices essenciais.
seoContent.disclaimer: Índices de liquidez devem ser analisados junto com outras métricas financeiras. Empresas sazonais podem mostrar padrões diferentes. Normas de indústria variam significativamente. Consulte profissionais financeiros para análise comprehensiva.

fr.title: Calculateur de Ratios de Liquidité
fr.seoTitle: Calculateur de Ratios de Liquidité - Quels Sont Mes Ratios de Liquidité?
fr.metaDescription: Calculez ratio courant, ratio rapide et ratio de trésorerie pour évaluer liquidité à court terme et capacité à remplir obligations immédiates.
longTailKeywords: quel est un bon ratio rapide
fr.description: Analysez liquidité à court terme de votre entreprise avec notre calculateur complet de ratios de liquidité. Calculez ratio courant, ratio rapide, ratio de trésorerie et fonds de roulement pour évaluer capacité à remplir obligations à court terme et gérer flux de trésorerie efficacement.
fr.summary: Calculez ratios clés de liquidité pour évaluer santé financière à court terme.
instructions: Entrez valeur d'actifs courants (trésorerie, stock, créances)
Saisissez passifs courants (dettes fournisseurs, dette à court terme)
Spécifiez valeur de stock pour calcul du ratio rapide
Entrez trésorerie et équivalents pour ratio de trésorerie
Cliquez calculer pour voir analyse complète de liquidité

seoContent.introduction: Liquidity ratios are essential financial metrics that measure a company's ability to meet its short-term obligations using its most liquid assets. Our liquidity ratios calculator helps you analyze current ratio, quick ratio, and cash ratio to assess financial health and operational efficiency. These ratios provide critical insights into cash management, working capital, and short-term solvency.
benefits: Assess ability to meet short-term obligations
Make informed credit and investment decisions
steps: Gather balance sheet information for current period
Enter current assets and liabilities data
Calculate multiple liquidity ratios simultaneously
Compare results with industry benchmarks
Monitor ratios over time for trend analysis
inputsExplained: Actifs Courants: Actifs attendus à être convertis en trésorerie dans un an
Passifs Courants: Obligations dues dans un an ou cycle opérationnel
Stock: Marchandises détenues à la vente ou matières premières (moins liquides)
Trésorerie et Équivalents: Actifs les plus liquides disponibles pour usage immédiat
seoContent.formulaExplanation: Les ratios de liquidité mesurent force financière à court terme. Ratio courant divise actifs courants par passifs courants. Ratio rapide exclut stock des actifs courants. Ratio de trésorerie utilise seulement trésorerie et équivalents. Fonds de roulement est actifs courants moins passifs courants.
examples: Ratio courant au-dessus de 2.0 indique liquidité forte mais peut suggérer utilisation inefficace d'actifs
Ratio rapide au-dessus de 1.0 montre capacité à remplir obligations sans vendre stock
Ratio de trésorerie au-dessus de 20% indique liquidité immédiate excellente
Fonds de roulement négatif peut signaler problèmes de flux de trésorerie
resultsExplanation: Ratio Courant: Mesure liquidité générale à court terme incluant tous actifs courants
Ratio Rapide: Évalue liquidité excluant stock (ratio test acide)
Ratio de Trésorerie: Mesure la plus conservatrice utilisant seulement trésorerie et équivalents
Fonds de Roulement: Excès d'actifs courants sur passifs courants
seoContent.whoItsFor: Ce calculateur est invaluable pour analystes financiers, propriétaires d'entreprises, créanciers, investisseurs et professionnels de comptabilité qui ont besoin d'évaluer santé financière à court terme. Toute personne impliquée dans analyse financière ou évaluation de crédit trouvera ces ratios essentiels.
seoContent.disclaimer: Les ratios de liquidité devraient être analysés aux côtés d'autres métriques financières. Les entreprises saisonnières peuvent montrer différents patterns. Les normes d'industrie varient significativement. Consultez professionnels financiers pour analyse complète.
